course_title: Topics: Historical Analysis: Native Amer. Hist since 1868
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 15 / Seats Avail: 15Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Same as AMST 285 2)


This course engages the history of Native peoples in North America after 1868. Integrating the materials and methods of Native American and Indigenous Studies, the class takes an interdisciplinary approach to the past and considers themes such as surviving assimilation, maintaining political sovereignties, revitalizing languages, restoring communities, reclaiming land, and envisioning self-determined futures.
Students have no out-of-pocket costs to participate in the class.
course_description: An introductory course on the nature and methods of history. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
sections: Class Nbr: 3699, Section #: 5, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 10-11:15a, Instructor: L. Mortimer, Status: Open
